description:
Conquest Solutions, LLC (CQS) is a leading application and engineering consulting firm in the Washington, D.C. metro area specializing in Building Automation Systems (BAS), Design-build and General Construction. We assist federal, state and local government agencies; private sector companies; and commercial entities in the design and implementation of their BAS and General Construction projects.

CQS employees enjoy a flexible, fun, and family-oriented work environment. We collaborate and learn from each other, which leads to each team member’s contribution having a huge impact on the overall growth of our company. We have a strong culture rooted in our core values of INTEGRITY, INCLUSION and INNOVATION. These values guide every aspect of our work and contribute to high levels of employee happiness that results in superior customer service to our client’s time and again.

Our rapidly growing company seeks an eager and hard-working professional to join our team as the Senior Building Automation System (BAS) Specialist to support the engineering and installation teams within our BAS department. This role is expected to operate independently, set priorities, and resolve competing needs to provide timely information and solve problems.

Responsibilities and duties include but are not limited to the following:

Responsibilities and Duties:
• Provide onsite/offsite support for the BAS programming, installation, commissioning, troubleshooting and checkout.
• Perform inspections, preventative and routine maintenance, and performance testing and verification of CQS installed BAS systems.
• Identify, isolate, and provide solutions for BAS system, software, infrastructure, component, and communication errors and issues.
• Repair, retrofit, modify, or remove components, in part or in whole, of the DDC systems including but is not limited to, hardware, software, HVAC, and low voltage (Mostly Class 2) electrical components, and wiring that is controlled or supported by the Direct Digital Control (DDC) systems.
• Perform calibration of electronic, electric, and pneumatic controllers, transistors, dampers, space temperature sensors, mixing boxes, end devices, and related components.
• Read, write, and update logic and code to support or enhance the logic developed or created by others, where required.
• May be required to visit job site to effectively gather information on existing system configuration or facility configurations and troubleshoot reported system anomalies.
• Verify and confirm sequences of operation for various systems through a BAS evaluation process.
• Assist and support in the accurate development of BAS engineering drawings, graphics, sequences of operations and specifications as required for new and existing BAS projects.
• Provide training to other assigned BAS field installation/technician and commissioning team members.
• Identify and investigate repeat issues, processes, and tasks and establish systems and solutions that ensure efficiency within the BAS commissioning and technician execution.
• Produce clear, concise, and comprehensive written/electronic reports detailing the status, work performed, deficiencies noted, and corrective actions taken to resolve issues.
• Lead quality assurance and commissioning efforts for a variety of DDC system components and sequences.
• Collaborate with project stakeholders (customers, supervisors, programmers, field personnel, other contractors) to achieve alignment on objectives, priorities, schedules, risks, features, etc. and ensuring they are well documented
• Perform routine tasks between the hours of 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. EST. Monday through Friday, except federal holidays
• Foster and maintain good working relationships with CQS employees, clients, subcontractors, and vendors.
• Ensure CQS business is conducted with the highest ethical standards.
• Perform other duties as assigned by leadership.

Job Qualifications:
• Minimum of 5 -10 years’ work experience in HVAC, Building Automation, or control systems with a minimum of 4 years directly working on any combination of integration, programming, checkout, testing, commissioning, and/or field support of DDC and/or PLC-based automation systems
• B.S. in Engineering or related field is preferred however verifiable field BAS controls engineering, programming and technician experience is acceptable.
• Must have experience and documented training with DDC systems.
• Mid-to-high proficiency in Tridium Niagara brand systems is preferrable.
• Must be able to read and analyze programming logic, graphics, configure/diagnose trending data, utilize/customize reporting information, and diagnose system network local and IP infrastructure (BACnet MSTP, BACnet/IP, Modbus, and Lonworks).
• Be knowledgeable of HVAC and electrical equipment and apparatus that are controlled (directly and indirectly) by the DDC system.
• Demonstrate working knowledge of automatic temperature controls implementation and theory, building automation systems best practices, and other building subsystem metering requirements.
• Demonstrate working knowledge of specification and design drawing review for control, electrical and mechanical applications to coordinate long-term and stable DDC usage based on such documentation, site observations, and industry best practices.
• Proficient in formulating work plans and perform troubleshooting methods given multiple constraints including project time requirements, lack of documentation from a site, or incomplete installation by others prior to CQS work.
• Must work independently with little or no supervision while providing guidance to other team members. Be able to prioritize and multi-task within time and technical constraints
• Excellent communication, organization and interpersonal skills required
• Possess the ability to explain technical information to technical and non-technical people
• Ability to be attentive and responsive to client concerns while communicating with CQS management for full team responses.
• Possess the ability to establish effective collaborative working relationships across different functional areas within the company.
• Must possess a high level of ownership, enthusiasm, and a collaborative, professional temperament.
• Must be open and flexible, take initiative and operate effectively with little oversight.
• Experience with MS suite of software for work tasking including Word, Excel, Project, and Outlook.
• Must be able to pass a stringent Government background check, reference check and a drug screening
• Ability to handle sensitive and/or confidential information.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; outside weather conditions; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

U.S. Citizenship Required.

Must be able to pass a background check, reference check and a pre-employment drug screening.

Employee Benefits
• Paid Holidays (14 days)
• Paid Time Off (starting at 15 days annually)
• 401k Retirement Plan with a company match program (maximum of 4% employer-match)
• 60% Employer-Provided Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurances
• 100% Employer-Provided Life & Disability Insurances

description_final: Conquest Solutions, LLC (CQS) es una firma líder de consultoría de aplicaciones e ingeniería en el área metropolitana de Washington, D. C. , especializada en sistemas de automatización de edificios (BAS), construcción de diseño y construcción general. Ayudamos a las agencias gubernamentales federales, estatales y locales; Empresas del sector privado; y entidades comerciales en el diseño e implementación de sus BAS y proyectos de construcción general. Los empleados de CQS disfrutan de un ambiente de trabajo flexible, divertido y orientado a la familia. Colaboramos y aprendemos unos de otros, lo que lleva a que la contribución de cada miembro del equipo tenga un gran impacto en el crecimiento general de nuestra empresa. Tenemos una cultura fuerte arraigada en nuestros valores centrales de integridad, inclusión e innovación. Estos valores guían todos los aspectos de nuestro trabajo y contribuyen a los altos niveles de felicidad de los empleados que resulta en un servicio al cliente superior al de nuestro cliente una y otra vez. Nuestra compañía de rápido crecimiento busca un profesional ansioso y trabajador para unirse a nuestro equipo como especialista en Senior Building Automation System (BAS) para apoyar a los equipos de ingeniería e instalación dentro de nuestro departamento de BAS. Se espera que este papel opere de forma independiente, establezca prioridades y resuelva las necesidades competitivas para proporcionar información oportuna y resolver problemas. Las responsabilidades y los deberes incluyen, entre otros, lo siguiente: Responsabilidades y deberes: proporcionar soporte en el sitio/fuera del sitio para la programación, instalación, puesta en servicio, resolución de problemas de BAS. Realice inspecciones, mantenimiento preventivo y de rutina, y pruebas de rendimiento y verificación de los sistemas BAS instalados CQS. Identificar, aislar y proporcionar soluciones para el sistema BAS, el software, la infraestructura, los componentes y los errores y problemas de comunicación. Repare, modifique, modifique o elimine los componentes, en parte o en su totalidad, de los sistemas DDC, incluidos, entre otros, hardware, software, HVAC y componentes eléctricos de bajo voltaje (principalmente clase 2), y cableado que está controlado o compatible con los sistemas de control digital directo (DDC). Realice la calibración de controladores electrónicos, eléctricos y neumáticos, transistores, amortiguadores, sensores de temperatura espacial, cajas de mezcla, dispositivos finales y componentes relacionados. Lea, escriba y actualice la lógica y el código para admitir o mejorar la lógica desarrollada o creada por otros, cuando sea necesario. Es posible que visite el sitio de trabajo para recopilar información de manera efectiva sobre la configuración del sistema existente o las configuraciones de las instalaciones y solucionar los problemas de las anomalías del sistema informadas. Verifique y confirme secuencias de operación para varios sistemas a través de un proceso de evaluación de BAS. Asistir y apoyar en el desarrollo preciso de dibujos de ingeniería BAS, gráficos, secuencias de operaciones y especificaciones según sea necesario para proyectos de BAS nuevos y existentes. Proporcionar capacitación a otros miembros de instalación/técnico de campo de BAS asignado y miembros del equipo de puesta en marcha. Identificar e investigar problemas repetidos, procesos y tareas y establecer sistemas y soluciones que garanticen la eficiencia dentro de la comisión y la ejecución del técnico de BAS. Producir informes escritos/electrónicos claros, concisos e integrales que detallan el estado, el trabajo realizado, las deficiencias observadas y las acciones correctivas tomadas para resolver problemas. Los esfuerzos de garantía de calidad y puesta en servicio de liderar para una variedad de componentes y secuencias del sistema DDC. Colabore con las partes interesadas del proyecto (clientes, supervisores, programadores, personal de campo, otros contratistas) para lograr la alineación de objetivos, prioridades, horarios, riesgos, características, etc. y asegurándose de que estén bien documentados realizan tareas rutinarias entre las 6:00 a. m. a las 2:00 p. m. Est. De lunes a viernes, excepto las fiestas federales fomentar y mantener buenas relaciones de trabajo con empleados, clientes, subcontratistas y proveedores de CQS. Asegúrese de que el negocio de CQS se realice con los más altos estándares éticos. Realizar otras tareas asignadas por el liderazgo. Calificaciones laborales: mínimo de 5 a 10 años de experiencia laboral en HVAC, automatización de edificios o sistemas de control con un mínimo de 4 años trabajando directamente en cualquier combinación de integración, programación, pago, pruebas, puesta en marcha y/o soporte de campo de Sistemas de automatización basados ​​en DDC y/o PLC B. S. En ingeniería o en el campo relacionado se prefiere, sin embargo, es aceptable la experiencia de ingeniería, programación y técnico de BAS de campo verificables. Debe tener experiencia y capacitación documentada con sistemas DDC. La competencia de mediana a alta en los sistemas de marca Tridium Niagara es preferible. Debe poder leer y analizar la lógica de programación, gráficos, configurar/diagnosticar datos de tendencia, utilizar/personalizar la información de informes y diagnosticar la infraestructura local e IP de la red del sistema (BACNET MSTP, BACNET/IP, MODBUS y LONWorks). Conocer el equipo y los aparatos de equipos eléctricos y de HVAC que están controlados (directa e indirectamente) por el sistema DDC. Demuestre el conocimiento práctico de la implementación y la teoría de los controles de temperatura automática, las mejores prácticas de los sistemas de automatización de construcción y otros requisitos de medición del subsistema de construcción. Demuestre el conocimiento práctico de las especificaciones y la revisión del dibujo de diseño para aplicaciones de control, electricidad y mecánica para coordinar el uso de DDC a largo plazo y estable basado en dicha documentación, observaciones del sitio y las mejores prácticas de la industria. Competente en la formulación de planes de trabajo y realizar métodos de solución de problemas dados múltiples restricciones, incluidos los requisitos de tiempo del proyecto, la falta de documentación de un sitio o la instalación incompleta de otros antes del trabajo de CQS. Debe trabajar independientemente con poca o ninguna supervisión al tiempo que proporciona orientación a otros miembros del equipo. Ser capaz de priorizar y realizar múltiples tareas dentro del tiempo y limitaciones técnicas excelentes comunicación, organización y habilidades interpersonales requeridas poseen la capacidad de explicar información técnica a las personas técnicas y no técnicas capacidad de estar atento y receptivo a las preocupaciones de los clientes mientras se comunica con la administración de CQS para las respuestas completas del equipo. Poseer la capacidad de establecer relaciones de trabajo colaborativas efectivas en diferentes áreas funcionales dentro de la empresa. Debe poseer un alto nivel de propiedad, entusiasmo y un temperamento colaborativo y profesional. Debe ser abierto y flexible, tomar iniciativa y operar de manera efectiva con poca supervisión. Experiencia con MS Suite of Software for Work Tasking, incluida Word, Excel, Project y Outlook. Debe poder aprobar una estricta verificación de antecedentes del gobierno, una verificación de referencia y una capacidad de detección de drogas para manejar información confidencial y/o confidencial. Demandas físicas Las demandas físicas descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado debe satisfacer con éxito las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, se requiere regularmente al empleado para sentarse; Usa las manos para el dedo, manejar, sentir y hablar o escuchar. El empleado se requiere con frecuencia para pararse; Camina y alcanza las manos y los brazos. Ocasionalmente se requiere que el empleado trepar o equilibrar y agacharse, arrodillarse, agacharse o arrastrarse. El empleado ocasionalmente debe levantar y/o moverse hasta 20 libras. Entorno de trabajo Las características del entorno de trabajo descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado encuentra mientras realiza las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado ocasionalmente está expuesto a condiciones húmedas y/o húmedas; Piezas mecánicas en movimiento; lugares altos y precarios; humos o partículas en el aire; condiciones climáticas externas; frío extremo; calor extremo; Riesgo de descarga eléctrica y vibración. El nivel de ruido en el entorno de trabajo suele ser moderado. Se requiere ciudadanía estadounidense. Debe poder pasar una verificación de antecedentes, una verificación de referencia y una detección de medicamentos previos al empleo. Beneficios de los empleados Vacaciones pagadas (14 días) tiempo libre pagado (a partir de los 15 días anuales) Plan de jubilación 401K con un programa de coincidencia de la empresa (máximo de 4% de participación) 60% Medical, dental y de visión de la empresa Insuficiencia 100% proporcionada por el empleador y discapacidad

job_title: IT Management Consultant, Robotic Process Automation-FMDDT AaaS
description:
At MBC, we believe we can. We believe in working hard to meet our clients’ outcomes. We believe in laughter to help us recharge, draw people together, foster a positive work environment, and boost creativity. We believe in listening to our employees, partners, and clients. We believe in always challenging ourselves, for it is through pushing our boundaries that we achieve our greatest successes. This mindset propels our employees and our teams to accomplish our goals. That’s where you come in. If you believe in these things too, you’re our kind of person!

We are seeking a seasoned IT Management Consultant to support a high-impact automation initiative within the Office of the Assistant Secretary of the Navy, Financial Management and Comptroller (FM&C), specifically the Financial Management Data and Digital Transformation (FMDDT) Automation as a Service (AaaS) portfolio. The IT Management Consultant will support the Program Manager in overseeing the delivery of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) with a focus on enhancing audit readiness and financial operations.

The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in Agile or SAFe program management, combined with a solid understanding of automation technologies and federal financial management processes.

Responsibilities:
• Lead end-to-end program management for automation projects, ensuring alignment with Navy FM&C strategic goals
• Coordinate across developers, business analysts, and Navy stakeholders
• Oversee the development and deployment of attended and unattended bots, with a roadmap toward full unattended automation
• Apply Agile or SAFe methodologies to manage project scope, timelines, and deliverables
• Coordinate with technical teams to ensure integration of RPA solutions with existing systems and data platforms (e.g., Palantir)
• Ensure compliance with DoD cybersecurity, data governance, and audit standards
• Provide regular updates to senior leadership and stakeholders through dashboards, briefings, and reports
• Lead and attend meetings and program reviews, assist with compiling presentations, written materials, and/or electronic communications as required
• Assist in managing contract deliverables and processes
• Travel domestically and internationally, provide in-person support at MBC and client sites, and obtain and maintain professional certifications and security clearances as required by MBC and/or MBC’s clients. These requirements are subject to change without advance notice at the discretion of MBC and MBC’s clients

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business, or related field
• Active Secret Security Clearance
• 7+ years of experience in IT program or project management, with at least 3 years in automation or RPA environments
• Proven experience managing Agile or SAFe projects (certification preferred: SAFe Agilist, PMI-ACP, or equivalent)
• Proven track record of delivering projects using agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban) with tools like Jira, Trello, or Azure DevOps for project management
• Familiarity with UiPath or similar RPA platforms
• Familiarity with MS Power Automate and other Power Apps
• Experience with Palantir or similar data integration platforms
• Working knowledge Python, C#, JavaScript, and VB.NET for scripting, custom bot development, and integration with RPA tools
• Expertise in process mining
• Familiarity with document understanding, OCR, and AI/ML integration in automation workflows
• Experience with DoD and Navy financial systems
• Strong understanding of federal financial management and audit processes
• Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder engagement skills
• Preferred certifications include UiPath Advanced RPA Developer, Automation Anywhere Certified Master RPA Professional, Blue Prism Developer Certification, or AWS Certified Solutions Architect
• Ability and willingness to travel domestically using a credit card or prepaid debit card as required by MBC and/or clients

Compensation Policy:

Salary ranges displayed are typical for this position, but MBC considers multiple factors when extending an offer. Factors include the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate's qualifications, and the contractual terms of the program.

What MBC offers:
• Competitive salaries
• Comprehensive medical plans (Aetna) with Employee Assistance Program (EAP), heath savings and flexible spending accounts, and dental and vision coverage options
• Opportunity to earn spot awards and annual, performance, and chargeability bonuses
• Traditional and Roth 401(K) plans
• Professional development including up to $2,000/year reimbursement for pre-approved courses, trainings, continued education, and/or certifications
• Paid Flexible Time Off
• 10 paid holidays

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

MBC is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status. We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program.

description_final: En MBC, creemos que podemos. Creemos en trabajar duro para cumplir con los resultados de nuestros clientes. Creemos en la risa para ayudarnos a recargarnos, unir a las personas, fomentar un ambiente de trabajo positivo e impulsar la creatividad. Creemos en escuchar a nuestros empleados, socios y clientes. Creemos en desafiarnos siempre a nosotros mismos, ya que es a través de nuestros límites que logramos nuestros mayores éxitos. Esta mentalidad impulsa a nuestros empleados y nuestros equipos a lograr nuestros objetivos. Ahí es donde entras. Si tú también crees en estas cosas, ¡eres nuestro tipo de persona! Estamos buscando un consultor experimentado de gestión de TI para apoyar una iniciativa de automatización de alto impacto dentro de la Oficina del Secretario Asistente de la Marina, la Gestión Financiera y el Contralor (FM&C), específicamente la automatización de datos de gestión financiera y transformación digital (FMDDT) como una cartera de servicio (AAAS). El consultor de gestión de TI apoyará al gerente del programa para supervisar la entrega de la automatización de procesos robóticos (RPA) con un enfoque en mejorar la preparación de auditorías y las operaciones financieras. El candidato ideal traerá una sólida experiencia en la gestión de programas ágil o segura, combinada con una comprensión sólida de las tecnologías de automatización y los procesos federales de gestión financiera. Todos los solicitantes calificados recibirán consideración para el empleo sin tener en cuenta la raza, el color, la religión, la discapacidad, el sexo, la orientación sexual, la identidad de género, el origen nacional o el estatus de veteranos protegidos. Participamos en el programa de verificación de empleo E-Verify.

description:
American Woodmark is one of the nation's largest cabinet manufacturers. By partnering with major home centers, builders, and dealers, we spark the imagination of homeowners and designer and bring their vision to life. Across our service and distribution centers, our corporate office and manufacturing facilities, you'll always find the same commitment to customer satisfaction, integrity, teamwork, and excellence.

We are on a journey to encourage an inclusive Woodmark, and are taking meaningful actions to promote diverse representation across every part of the business. Together, every team member contributes to making American Woodmark a place where people can express who they are through what they do.

Purpose

As Sr. Automation Engineer, you will identify, develop, and execute projects to automate varied manufacturing processes. You will be responsible for understanding operations’ requirements, developing tailored automation strategies, and ensuring seamless integration of automation technologies to enhance operational efficiency and productivity. This corporate position will work closely with multiple manufacturing facilities across the U.S. and Mexico to identify and implement areas where automation can improve efficiency and reduce costs. This position will develop, execute, and deliver projects for our manufacturing plants as well as act in an advisory role on plant-led projects.

Essential Job Functions
• Client Engagement and Requirements Gathering:
• Collaborate closely with client plants to understand their automation needs and operational challenges.
• Conduct thorough assessments of existing systems and processes to identify areas for automation; including identifying process combination, process changes, etc.
• Develop a comprehensive range of outcomes:
• With well-trained Critical and Economic Thinking skills and deep understanding of manufacturing processes and technologies, develop an array of automation possibilities
• Assess risk, upsides, costs and recommendations for the potential alternatives
• Relate thought process and recommendation to stakeholders and get their feedback and approvals
• Project execution:
• Work with and through others to apply best in class project implementation knowledge
• Seek and share knowledge from stakeholders to ensure new technologies are adopted and leveraged as intended
• Engage appropriate vendors through quoting and design processes
• Manage vendor performance, coordinate design reviews, installation needs, system testing and commissioning, providing on-site support and troubleshooting during the initial startup phase
• Manage projects to completion, leading/interacting with collaborative teams that might include Manufacturing, Materials, Quality, and other functions.
• Provide operations with training, documentation, maintenance and operations procedures to successfully operate equipment
• Demonstrated Leadership and well-developed management skills
• Continuous Improvement:
• Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in automation technologies.
• Recommend and implement enhancements to existing automation systems to optimize performance and efficiency.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related field such as robotics, automation, industrial, or manufacturing
• 5-7 years experience in developing and executing manufacturing automation projects
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to design processes to meet current and future needs
• Excellent communication skills to interact effectively with plants, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams.
• Proven experience on leading and presenting projects to all levels of an organization.
• Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Project management skills to coordinate and oversee automation projects from inception to completion.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, knell, bend, twist, and walk. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is required to speak and communicate with other employees, be able to hear well enough to recognize warning signals, forklifts, and announcements. The employee is frequently required to lift up to 20 pounds and occasionally up to 50 pounds.

Working Conditions

Indoor office and manufacturing environments. The noise level is usually moderate to high and hearing protection may be required in manufacturing settings. Safety glasses are required. Varied schedules, travel, and weekend work required.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

The American Woodmark Corporation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, ancestry, age, religion, military and veteran status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other legally-protected characteristic; and it will comply with all applicable state discrimination laws. No person will be denied employment solely because of a disability, provided that the person can perform the essential functions of the position for which the person has applied, either with or without reasonable accommodations.

Al asociarnos con los principales centros de origen, constructores y distribuidores, provocamos la imaginación de los propietarios y diseñadores y damos vida a su visión. description:
Requisition: 1051

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer

Clearance: Public Trust clearance

Location: Remote

Overview:

IntelliBridge is an award-winning national security company looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer with experience in TypeScript or JavaScript to support our contract with the U. S. Customs and Immigration Service (USCIS).

As a Quality Assurance Engineer at IntelliBridge, you will be part of an integrated project team delivering scalable and secure solutions. You will use user-centered and agile methodologies to build and continuously deploy server and client-side solutions. You will perform in AWS cloud environment to support the continuous development, deployment, integration, and monitoring of server and client-side solutions. As a member of a project delivery team, you will collaborate with project and product managers, user experience designers, and business analysts. Your efforts will directly serve and assist end-users. Your work will be produced in the context of IntelliBridge’s DevSecOps practices, including but not limited to continuous development, deployment, integration, and monitoring. Quality Assurance Engineer at IntelliBridge are expected to have experience delivering secure technical implementation as well as developing and integrating server and client applications.

As a direct employee of IntelliBridge, you would receive a benefit package that includes health/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401K with company match, PTO & paid holidays, and annual tuition/training assistance. For more information, please visit our website.

Clearance:
• Public Trust clearance requires a background investigation (BI) and entry on duty (EOD) status. This must be applied for upon acceptance of employment offer. Candidates with existing or recently completed Public Trust background investigations are preferred.

Responsibilities/Duties:
• Produce quality and maintainable test scripts
• Collaborate with business analysts and developers to fully understand the full scope and impact of each story to the test scenario.
• Create and update automated test scripts based upon developed agile stories using TestCafe.
• Create ad-hoc tests using SoapUI and other tools to work through new scenarios.
• Estimate test case writing and execution effort and track progress.
• Design test strategies, test plans, and test cases from requirements, design documents and specifications.
• Develop code-based test scripts using TypeScript and hold test case reviews with stakeholders
• Execute test cases including functional, regression, performance, load and smoke tests for both web applications and database.
• Report defects, track, validate, and close.
• Record test results and report them.
• Support 508 compliance test execution and documentation.
• Identify regression test candidates for automation, plan automation activities across the team and automate test cases.
• Support and improve the overall system
• Participate in daily scrum meetings, agile ceremonies, and weekly test team meetings.
• Participate in all phases of risk management assessments and software development with emphasis on analysis of user requirements, test design and test tools selection.
• Install, maintain, or use software testing programs.
• Support and track and gather metrics on all activities.
• Support UAT activities.
• Support end of sprint demos, user acceptance testing, and solicit feedback on test artifacts and processes.
• Knowledge of RESTful API-based applications
• Experience in Manual Test Script Development and Execution
• Proven experience with the following technologies:
• Experience with Selenium, Serenity, or Cucumber
• TypeScript/JavaScript
• TestCafe or similar framework
• AWS
• JSON
• Jira
• GIT commands
• HTML and DOM object identification
• Chrome Dev Tools
• NPM and Node.js and capability of managing npm packages and versions
• Accessibility testing
• Development Methodologies: Test Driven Development, Agile Software Delivery, Scrum, Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment

Required Qualifications:
• Minimum of five (5) years of experience in writing and testing enterprise software solutions. A degree in Computer Science and three (3) years of experience is also acceptable.
• 5+ years of development experience in the Information Technology field focusing on development projects using DevSecOps
• Minimum of three (3) years of experience in troubleshooting software.
• Minimum of three (3) years of automation framework development experience
• Expert skills in test automation tools including TestCafe
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills
• Strong communication skills
• Experience working in AWS, software containerization and Agile development processes.

About Us:

IntelliBridge delivers IT strategy, cloud, cybersecurity, application, data and analytics, enterprise IT, intelligence analysis, and mission operation support services to accelerate technical performance and efficiency for Defense, Civilian, and National Security & Federal Law Enforcement clients.

UU. (USCIS). Como ingeniero de garantía de calidad en Intellibridge, usted formará parte de un equipo de proyecto integrado que ofrece soluciones escalables y seguras. Utilizará metodologías ágiles centradas en el usuario para construir e implementar continuamente soluciones de servidor y lado del cliente. Se espera que el ingeniero de garantía de calidad en Intellibridge tenga experiencia en la entrega de una implementación técnica segura, así como desarrollar e integrar aplicaciones de servidores y clientes. Como empleado directo de IntelliBridge, recibiría un paquete de beneficios que incluye cobertura de seguro de salud/dental/visión, 401k con la coincidencia de la empresa, las vacaciones en PTO y el pago y la asistencia anual de matrícula/capacitación. Para obtener más información, visite nuestro sitio web. Autorización: la autorización de confianza pública requiere una investigación de antecedentes (BI) y el estado de entrada de servicio (EOD). Esto debe solicitarse al aceptar la oferta de empleo. Se prefieren los candidatos con investigaciones de antecedentes de confianza pública existentes o recientemente completadas. Responsabilidades/deberes: producir la calidad y los scripts de prueba mantenibles colaboran con analistas y desarrolladores de negocios para comprender completamente el alcance completo y el impacto de cada historia en el escenario de prueba. Cree y actualice scripts de prueba automatizados basados ​​en historias ágiles desarrolladas usando TestCafe. Cree pruebas ad-hoc utilizando SoapUI y otras herramientas para trabajar a través de nuevos escenarios. Estime la redacción de casos de prueba y el esfuerzo de ejecución y rastree el progreso. Estrategias de prueba de diseño, planes de prueba y casos de prueba de requisitos, documentos de diseño y especificaciones. Desarrolle los scripts de prueba basados ​​en el código utilizando revisiones de casos de prueba de TypeScript y retención con las partes interesadas que ejecutan casos de prueba, incluidas pruebas funcionales, de regresión, rendimiento, carga y humo para aplicaciones web y base de datos. Informe defectos, rastrear, validar y cerrar. Registre los resultados de las pruebas e repórtelos. Soporte 508 Ejecución y documentación de la prueba de cumplimiento. Identifique los candidatos de prueba de regresión para la automatización, planifique actividades de automatización en todo el equipo y automatice los casos de prueba. Apoye y mejore el sistema general Participe en reuniones diarias de scrum, ceremonias ágiles y reuniones semanales del equipo de prueba. Participe en todas las fases de las evaluaciones de gestión de riesgos y el desarrollo de software con énfasis en el análisis de los requisitos del usuario, el diseño de la prueba y la selección de herramientas de prueba. Instale, mantenga o use programas de prueba de software. Apoye y rastree y recopile métricas en todas las actividades. Apoyar las actividades de UAT. Apoyo a las demostraciones de Sprint, pruebas de aceptación del usuario y solicitar comentarios sobre artefactos y procesos de prueba. Knowledge of RESTful API-based applications Experience in Manual Test Script Development and Execution Proven experience with the following technologies: Experience with Selenium, Serenity, or Cucumber TypeScript/JavaScript TestCafe or similar framework AWS JSON Jira GIT commands HTML and DOM object identification Chrome Dev Tools NPM and Node. js and capability of managing npm packages and versions Accessibility testing Development Methodologies: Test Driven Development, Entrega de software ágil, scrum, integración continua/implementación continua requerida calificaciones: mínimo de cinco (5) años de experiencia en la escritura y prueba de soluciones de software empresarial. Un título en informática y tres (3) años de experiencia también es aceptable. Más de 5 años de experiencia en desarrollo en el campo de la tecnología de la información centrada en proyectos de desarrollo utilizando DevSecops mínimo de tres (3) años de experiencia en el software de solución de problemas. Mínimo de tres (3) años de Automation Framework Desarrollo Experiencia Habilidades Expertos en herramientas de automatización de pruebas, incluida la experiencia de TestCafe trabajando en un entorno ágil, fuertes habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas de habilidades de comunicación sólida experiencia trabajando en AWS, contenedores de software y procesos de desarrollo ágil. Acerca de nosotros: Intellibridge ofrece estrategia de TI, nubes, ciberseguridad, aplicación, datos y análisis, TI empresarial, análisis de inteligencia y servicios de apoyo de operación de misión para acelerar el rendimiento técnico y la eficiencia para los clientes de defensa, seguridad civil y nacional y aplicación de la ley federales.

description:
Building Automation System Electrician

Conquest Solutions, LLC (CQS) is a leading application and engineering consulting firm in the Washington, D.C. metro area specializing in Building Automation Systems (BAS), Design-build and General Construction. We assist federal, state and local government agencies, private sector companies; and commercial entities in the design and implementation of their BAS and General Construction projects.

CQS employees enjoy a flexible, fun, and family-oriented work environment. We collaborate and learn from each other, which leads to each team member’s contribution having a huge impact on the overall growth of our company. We have a strong culture rooted in our core values of INTEGRITY, INCLUSION, and INNOVATION. These values guide every aspect of our work and contribute to high levels of employee happiness that results in superior customer service to our client’s time and again.

CQS has an exciting opportunity for a Building Automation System Electrician to join our team to support the implementation of building automation systems for multiple clients in the Washington, DC Metro Area and some other parts of the country. This position has a 90-day introductory period.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Responsibilities and duties include but are not limited to the following:
• Electrical installation of Floor Level, Mechanical Room Level, Plant Level, Roof Level BAS applications
• Install, wire, and terminate controllers, and instrumentation devices.
• Install and bend conduit, wiring and cabling systems.
• Laying out work to support a successful BAS installation.
• Perform troubleshooting methods given multiple constraints including project time requirements, lack of documentation from a site, or incomplete installation by others prior to CQS work.
• Work around other trades to install your work.
• Manage time effectively as a team player reporting directly to the BAS Electrical Foreman.
• Be punctual to support teammates and lead successful project delivery.
• Produce clear, concise, and comprehensive written/electronic reports detailing the status, work performed, deficiencies noted, and corrective actions to the BAS Electrical Foreman.
• Maintain a high standard of quality and professionalism with regards to workmanship, customer relations, team members, behavior, and appearance.
• Work safely at all times.

Work Hours:
• Monday through Friday. Start times vary between 6am and 7am. (Depending on project schedule).
• A normal workday is 8 work hours. A normal workweek is 40 work hours.
• Some projects or tasks may require Overtime hours on nights or weekends as required to meet project schedule.

Job Qualifications:
• Has at least 5 years of work experience in the installation of BAS.
• A journeyman's electrical license (or higher) is preferred.
• High school or equivalent (Preferred).
• Capable of using basic hand and trade specific tools necessary to perform required work.
• Experience in hardware verification preferred.
• Ability to read and comprehend technical drawings, schematics, specifications, and system manuals and BAS submittal drawings.
• Be knowledgeable in HVAC and electrical equipment and apparatus that are controlled (directly and indirectly) by the DDC system.
• Demonstrate working knowledge of automatic temperature controls implementation and theory, building automation systems best practices, and other building subsystem metering requirements.
• Must work independently with little or no supervision while providing guidance to other team members.
• Excellent communication, organization and interpersonal skills required.
• Ability to be attentive and responsive to client concerns while communicating with CQS management for full team responses.
• Ability to prioritize and multi-task within time and technical constraints.
• Ability to establish effective collaborative working relationships across different functional areas.
• Must possess a high level of ownership, enthusiasm, and a collaborative, professional temperament.
• Must be able to pass a stringent Government background check, reference check and a drug screening.
• Possess and maintain a valid state issued motor vehicle license with a clean driving record as required by the company’s insurance carrier to qualify to operate a company vehicle (if eligible).

Work Environment:
• The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
• While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; outside weather conditions; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
• At times, this job can be physically demanding.
• Capable of climbing and working from ladders and ariel lifts, pulling action, lifting 60 pounds, overhead work, kneeling, crouching, and bending.

Requirements:
• Minimum US Permanent Resident status is required. US Citizenship is preferred.
• Ability to obtain federal government security clearance for access to secure government facilities is desirable.
• Must have the ability to pass a background check, reference check, and pre-employment drug screening.

Employee Benefits
• Paid Holidays (14 days)
• Paid Time Off (starting at 10 days annually)
• 401k Retirement Plan with company match program (maximum 4% company match)
• 60% Employer-Provided Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurances for Employee + Family
• 100% Employer-Provided Life & Disability Insurances for Employee
• Company-Provided Vehicle or Vehicle Allowance May be Applicable
• State Prevailing Wage Rates & Fringe Benefits May be Applicable

description_final: El sistema de automatización de edificios Electrician Conquest Solutions, LLC (CQS) es una firma líder de consultoría de aplicaciones e ingeniería en el área metropolitana de Washington, D. C. , especializada en sistemas de automatización de edificios (BAS), construcción de diseño y construcción general. Ayudamos a las agencias gubernamentales federales, estatales y locales, empresas del sector privado; y entidades comerciales en el diseño e implementación de sus BAS y proyectos de construcción general. Los empleados de CQS disfrutan de un ambiente de trabajo flexible, divertido y orientado a la familia. Colaboramos y aprendemos unos de otros, lo que lleva a que la contribución de cada miembro del equipo tenga un gran impacto en el crecimiento general de nuestra empresa. Tenemos una cultura fuerte arraigada en nuestros valores centrales de integridad, inclusión e innovación. Estos valores guían todos los aspectos de nuestro trabajo y contribuyen a los altos niveles de felicidad de los empleados que resulta en un servicio al cliente superior al de nuestro cliente una y otra vez. CQS tiene una oportunidad emocionante para que un electricista del sistema de automatización de edificios se una a nuestro equipo para apoyar la implementación de sistemas de automatización de edificios para múltiples clientes en el área metropolitana de Washington, DC y algunas otras partes del país. Esta posición tiene un período introductorio de 90 días. Responsabilidades y deberes: las responsabilidades y los deberes incluyen, entre otras, lo siguiente: Instalación eléctrica del nivel de piso, nivel de habitación mecánica, nivel de planta, aplicaciones de BAS de nivel de techo instalando, alambre y terminan controladores y dispositivos de instrumentación. Instale y dobla los sistemas de conducto, cableado y cableado. Presentar trabajo para admitir una instalación de BAS exitosa. Realice los métodos de solución de problemas dados múltiples restricciones, incluidos los requisitos de tiempo del proyecto, la falta de documentación de un sitio o la instalación incompleta de otros antes del trabajo de CQS. Trabaje alrededor de otras operaciones para instalar su trabajo. Administre el tiempo de manera efectiva como un jugador de equipo que informa directamente al Capataz de Bas Electrical. Sea puntual para apoyar a los compañeros de equipo y liderar la entrega exitosa del proyecto. Producir informes escritos/electrónicos claros, concisos e integrales que detallan el estado, el trabajo realizado, las deficiencias observadas y las acciones correctivas al Capataz Electrical BAS. Mantenga un alto nivel de calidad y profesionalismo con respecto a la mano de obra, las relaciones con los clientes, los miembros del equipo, el comportamiento y la apariencia. Trabajar de manera segura en todo momento. Horario de trabajo: de lunes a viernes. Los tiempos de inicio varían entre las 6 a. m. y las 7 a. m. (Dependiendo del horario del proyecto). Una jornada laboral normal es de 8 horas de trabajo. Una semana laboral normal es de 40 horas de trabajo. Algunos proyectos o tareas pueden requerir horas extras en las noches o fines de semana según sea necesario para cumplir con el horario del proyecto. Calificaciones laborales: tiene al menos 5 años de experiencia laboral en la instalación de BAS. Se prefiere la licencia eléctrica de un oficial (o superior). Secundaria o equivalente (preferido). Capaz de usar herramientas básicas de mano y comercio necesarios para realizar el trabajo requerido. Experiencia en la verificación de hardware preferida. Capacidad para leer y comprender dibujos técnicos, esquemas, especificaciones y manuales de sistemas y dibujos de presentación de BAS. Conocimiento en equipos y aparatos de HVAC y eléctricos que el sistema DDC controle (directa e indirectamente). Demuestre el conocimiento práctico de la implementación y la teoría de los controles de temperatura automática, las mejores prácticas de los sistemas de automatización de construcción y otros requisitos de medición del subsistema de construcción. Debe trabajar independientemente con poca o ninguna supervisión al tiempo que proporciona orientación a otros miembros del equipo. Excelente comunicación, organización y habilidades interpersonales requeridas. Capacidad para estar atento y responder a las preocupaciones del cliente mientras se comunica con la administración de CQS para las respuestas completas del equipo. Capacidad para priorizar y realizar múltiples tareas dentro del tiempo y las limitaciones técnicas. Capacidad para establecer relaciones de trabajo colaborativas efectivas en diferentes áreas funcionales. Debe poseer un alto nivel de propiedad, entusiasmo y un temperamento colaborativo y profesional. Debe poder pasar una estricta verificación de antecedentes del gobierno, una verificación de referencia y una detección de drogas. Poseer y mantener una licencia de vehículo de motor emitido por el estado válido con un historial de manejo limpio según lo exige la compañía de seguros de la compañía para calificar para operar un vehículo de la compañía (si es elegible). Entorno de trabajo: las características del entorno laboral descritas aquí son representativas de aquellos que un empleado encuentra mientras realiza las funciones esenciales de este trabajo. Se pueden hacer adaptaciones razonables para permitir que las personas con discapacidades realicen las funciones esenciales. Mientras realiza las tareas de este trabajo, el empleado ocasionalmente está expuesto a condiciones húmedas y/o húmedas; Piezas mecánicas en movimiento; lugares altos y precarios; humos o partículas en el aire; condiciones climáticas externas; frío extremo; calor extremo; Riesgo de descarga eléctrica y vibración. El nivel de ruido en el entorno de trabajo suele ser moderado. A veces, este trabajo puede ser físicamente exigente. Capaz de escalar y trabajar desde escaleras y ascensores de Ariel, tirar de la acción, levantar 60 libras, trabajar en alto, arrodillarse, agacharse y doblarse. Requisitos: se requiere un estado mínimo de residente permanente en los EE. UU. Se prefiere la ciudadanía estadounidense. La capacidad de obtener la autorización de seguridad del gobierno federal para el acceso a las instalaciones gubernamentales seguras es deseable. Debe tener la capacidad de pasar una verificación de antecedentes, verificación de referencia y detección de medicamentos previos al empleo. Beneficios de los empleados Vacaciones pagadas (14 días) tiempo libre pagado (a partir de los 10 días anuales) Plan de jubilación 401K con el programa de coincidencia de la empresa (máximo 4% de coincidencia de la empresa) 60% de 60%

description:
Business Technology Integrators (BTI), headquartered in suburban Washington, D.C., is seeking a highly seasoned Network Automation SME and leader with highly seasoned, advanced hands-on scripting and software development experience. CCNP (CCIE level preferred) with at least 15 years of related network, data center, and network monitoring system experience that is a proven leader with polished consultative and communications skills that has a track record for building trusted advisor relationships with clients.

Qualified candidates must also work well with others, be highly dependable, strong, dedicated work ethic, self-directed, but collaborative, and possess the following expertise:
• SME level expertise with automation and development of full web stack to include Advanced Python Scripting experience and PHP full web stack is required!
• Ansible IT Network Automation desirable.
• Network Management System skills – familiar with SNMP based products such as SolarWinds, Capterra, Infoblox and Stealthwatch to implement, operate, and advise VA is highly preferred.
• Juniper or Aruba experience, in addition to Cisco networking, is a plus.
• Strong LAN/WAN Networking systems management troubleshooting with SNMP, ACL, DNS, DHCP, SSH command line is a plus.
• Self-Starter with the ability to conduct repetitive tasks without involvement of senior network engineering teams.
• Identify configuration problems and analysis before significant service availability arise.
• Discover network constructs and topologies, including layer 3 virtual routing and VRFs as well as subnets, routes, VLAN’s, VRPP pairs and more.
• Enforce, standardize change processes and complex network changes, at scale.
• Seasoned professional with polished client relationship, communications, collaborative and consultative advisory skills
• Strong technical documentation and Visio skills

description:
Job Description
This position is for an IAS/ATG/OPS/GVS Electronics Technician. Working alone or in small teams, this individual will perform testing and maintenance functions on Automatic Tank Gauging Systems, Independent Alarm Systems, Overfill Protection Systems, and Ground Verification Systems at Department of Defense installations across, but not limited to, the following states; Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, and New England.
The Electronics Technician ensures proper operation of fuels accounting, alarm monitoring and controls, and leak detection equipment. Troubleshoot, diagnose, repair and install electronic components and electrical systems using hand tools and testing instruments, and keeps organized, detailed records of work performed.

Responsible for coordinating travel to customer sites, maintaining on-hand components and assigned safety equipment, and supplying basic hand tools & testing equipment, as well as thorough communication with dispatchers, your manager, and installation teams to ensure schedule is maintained and delays are properly conveyed to the customer.

Technician is required to compile and reconcile travel charging on a weekly basis.

Individual may reside anywhere within the states listed above and will travel extensively, but not exclusively, throughout that region to perform preventive and corrective maintenance at sites such as JB McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, Fort Drum, Hanscom AFB, NSB New London, Camp Keyes, Willow Grove ANG, & Dover AFB.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills

Ability to acquire and maintain U.S. government security clearance and/or Common Access Card (CAC)

Ability to acquire and maintain corporate credit card

Ability to travel 100%

Ability to forecast workload and manage level of effort within scheduled work week

Valid state driver's license

High school diploma or equivalent and formal electronics training from technical school, Class A or B military school, or completion of four-year electronics apprenticeship program

Four years of practical experience to include: electronics repair, integration, fielding, and checkout

Ability to acquire all required certifications to maintain the equipment located within specified region at the time of hire or relocation, to include all manufacture trainings and state-required UST certifications

Proven proficiency with Windows OS and M365 applications

Ability to kneel, lift up to 50 pounds, work from heights of up to 50 feet, and operate safely within confined spaces

Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills
Four years of experience performing installation, removal, maintenance, and testing on Fuel Handling components- gauges, instrumentation, and sensors
Experience with Government fuel accounting systems (AFHE, FMD, FAS, BSM-E, ATG)

Experience with Automatic Tank Gauging Systems including one or more of the following: Veeder-Root, Ronan, Enraf, Barton, Pneumercator, Temposonics/MTS, ProGauge, and E&H

Experience with Independent Alarm Systems including one or more of the following: Scully, Magnetrol, E&H, Fafnir, Mercoid, Omnitrol, Pneumecator, TLC, Bindicator, Devar, Aggressive Systems, and Programmable Logic Controllers

Experience with Overfill Protection or Ground Verification Systems including one or more of the following: Scully, Varec, Fafnir, and Programmable Logic Controllers

Experience with data communications via copper wires, fiber optics, & wireless devices

CAC must be obtained within 30 days

Certifications and/or demonstrated proficiency of applicable equipment manufactures and UST licenses must be established within five months of hire

Pay Information
This position is covered by a wage law called the McNamara-O'Hara Service Contract Act (SCA). The wage range for this position is determined by the Wage and Hour Division of the Department of Labor on a contract-by-contract basis.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts - defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team-making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do-from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

description_final: Descripción del trabajo Este puesto es para un técnico de electrónica IAS/ATG/OPS/GVS. Trabajando solo o en equipos pequeños, este individuo realizará funciones de prueba y mantenimiento en sistemas automáticos de medición de tanques, sistemas de alarma independientes, sistemas de protección de sobrecarga y sistemas de verificación de tierra en instalaciones del Departamento de Defensa, entre otros, los siguientes estados; Delaware, Maryland, Nueva Jersey, Nueva York, Pensilvania y Nueva Inglaterra. El técnico de electrónica garantiza un funcionamiento adecuado de la contabilidad de combustibles, monitoreo de alarmas y controles, y equipos de detección de fugas. Solucionar problemas, diagnosticar, reparar e instalar componentes electrónicos y sistemas eléctricos utilizando herramientas manuales e instrumentos de prueba, y mantiene realizados registros de trabajo organizados y detallados. Responsable de coordinar los viajes a los sitios de los clientes, mantener componentes a mano y equipos de seguridad asignados, y suministrar herramientas manuales básicas y equipos de prueba, así como una comunicación exhaustiva con los despachadores, su gerente y los equipos de instalación para garantizar que se mantenga el horario y los retrasos se transmitan correctamente al cliente. Se requiere que el técnico compilara y concilie la carga de viajes semanalmente. El individuo puede residir en cualquier lugar dentro de los estados enumerados anteriormente y viajará ampliamente, pero no exclusivamente, en toda esa región para realizar mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo en sitios como JB McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, Fort Drum, Hanscom AFB, NSB New London, Camp Keyes, Willow Grove Ang y Dover AFB. Required Education, Experience, & Skills Ability to acquire and maintain U. S. government security clearance and/or Common Access Card (CAC) Ability to acquire and maintain corporate credit card Ability to travel 100% Ability to forecast workload and manage level of effort within scheduled work week Valid state driver's license High school diploma or equivalent and formal electronics training from technical school, Class A or B military school, or completion of four-year electronics apprenticeship program Four years of practical experience to include: electronics repair, La integración, el campo y la capacidad de pago para adquirir todas las certificaciones requeridas para mantener los equipos ubicados dentro de la región especificada en el momento de la contratación o reubicación, para incluir todos los capacitaciones de fabricación y certificaciones de UST requendidas por el estado, la competencia comprobada con Windows OS y las aplicaciones de M365, la capacidad de las aplicaciones, la capacidad de las cuatro libras, y las cuatro libras, la experiencia de las alturas de hasta 50 pies, y operan con seguros de la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia, la experiencia de la experiencia, las cosas de la experiencia, la experiencia, las personas de la experiencia, las personas de la experiencia, las personas de la experiencia, las personas de la experiencia, las primeras. Eliminación, mantenimiento y pruebas sobre componentes de manejo de combustible: indicadores, instrumentación y experiencia de sensores con sistemas de contabilidad de combustible gubernamental (AFHE, FMD, FAS, BSM-E, ATG) Experiencia con sistemas automáticos de medición de tanques incluyendo uno o más de los siguientes: Veeder-Root, Ronan, Enraf, Barton, Pneumercator, Temposonics/Mts, ProgauGe, y eMt Experience, y eMt Experience, y eMt Experience, y eMtsing to Pneumercator, Temposonics/Mts, ProgauGe, y eMt Experience, y eMt Experience, y eMt Experience, y EtReue Alarm Systems including one or more of the following: Scully, Magnetrol, E&H, Fafnir, Mercoid, Omnitrol, Pneumecator, TLC, Bindicator, Devar, Aggressive Systems, and Programmable Logic Controllers Experience with Overfill Protection or Ground Verification Systems including one or more of the following: Scully, Varec, Fafnir, and Programmable Logic Controllers Experience with data communications via copper wires, fiber La óptica y los dispositivos inalámbricos CAC deben obtenerse dentro de las certificaciones de 30 días y/o el dominio demostrado de los fabricantes de equipos aplicables y las licencias de UST deben establecerse dentro de los cinco meses posteriores a la información de pago de alquiler, este puesto está cubierto por una ley salarial llamada Ley de Contrato de Servicio McNamara-O'Hara (SCA). El rango salarial para este puesto está determinado por la división salarial y hora del Departamento de Trabajo sobre contrato por contrato. Beneficios de los empleados: en BAE Systems, apoyamos a nuestros empleados en todos los aspectos de su vida, incluido su salud y bienestar financiero. Se ofrecen empleados regulares programados para trabajar más de 20 horas por semana: seguro de salud, dental y de visión; Cuentas de ahorro para la salud; un plan de ahorro 401 (k); cobertura por discapacidad; y seguro de vida y accidente. También tenemos un programa de asistencia para empleados, un plan legal y otras ventajas que incluyen descuentos en cosas como el seguro de hogar, automóvil y mascotas. Nuestros programas de licencia incluyen tiempo libre pagado, vacaciones pagadas, así como otros tipos de licencia, incluidos los padres pagados, militares, duelo y cualquier licencia por enfermedad federal y estatal aplicable. Los empleados pueden participar en el programa de reconocimiento de la empresa para recibir premios de reconocimiento monetario o no monetario. Otros incentivos pueden estar disponibles en función del nivel de posición y/o los detalles del trabajo. Acerca de BAE Systems Intelligence & Security Bae Systems, Inc. es la subsidiaria estadounidense de Bae Systems Plc, una compañía internacional de defensa, aeroespacial y de seguridad que ofrece una gama completa de productos y servicios para las fuerzas aéreas, terrestres y navales, así como electrónica avanzada, seguridad, soluciones de tecnología de la información y servicios de atención al cliente. Mejorar el futuro y proteger la vida es una misión ambiciosa, pero es lo que hacemos en BAE Systems. Trabajar aquí significa usar su pasión e ingenio donde cuenta: defender la seguridad nacional con tecnología innovadora, productos superiores y soluciones de inteligencia. A medida que desarrolle la última tecnología y defienda la seguridad nacional, continuamente perfeccionará sus habilidades en un gran impacto en un gran impacto a escala global. En BAE Systems, encontrará una carrera gratificante que realmente hace la diferencia. Inteligencia y seguridad (I&S), con sede en McLean, Virginia, diseña y ofrece soluciones avanzadas de defensa, inteligencia y seguridad que respaldan las importantes misiones de nuestros clientes. Nuestro orgullo y dedicación se muestra en todo lo que hacemos desde análisis de inteligencia, operaciones cibernéticas y experiencia en TI para el desarrollo de sistemas, la integración de sistemas y los servicios de operaciones y mantenimiento. Saber que nuestro trabajo permite que el ejército y el gobierno de los EE. UU. Reconocer, administrar y derrotar las amenazas nos inspiran a empujarnos a nosotros mismos y a nuestras tecnologías a nuevos niveles. Este puesto se publicará durante al menos 5 días calendario. La publicación permanecerá activa hasta que se llene el puesto, o se identifique un grupo calificado de candidatos.

description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today's most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It's also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it's no wonder we're consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Seramount, Fair360 and others. If you're as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Manager, Automation & Reliability to join our Digital Nexus technology organization. This is a hybrid work opportunity.

Responsibilities:
• Participate in the development of strategy, roadmaps, and appropriate technology choices; stay abreast of current industry trends, best practices, tools, and technologies to keep innovation at the forefront
• Lead our Infrastructure as Code initiative to automate the deployment of various workplace technologies such as Cisco Codecs, Crestron Scheduling panels, Brightsign Media Players, Biamp audio devices, Samsung Displays, and more
• Partner with operational support teams, internal business units, and vendors to analyze products and processes, identifying areas for improvement and operational efficiencies
• Collaborate with product owners and other subject matter experts (SMEs) to ensure the adoption of platforms that support maximum extensibility and have the necessary application programming interface (APIs) for seamless future development
• Maintain and enhance existing code developments, ensuring they meet current standards and are optimized for performance and reliability; implement CI/CD pipelines to automate testing, integration, and deployment processes, ensuring continuous delivery of high-quality code

Qualifications:
• Minimum four years of recent experience as an automation engineer, site reliability engineer, or devops engineer
• Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university is preferred
• Experience with Cisco RoomOS development utilizing xAPI and Macros; proficiency in Python, Java, Ansible and similar
• Background with building integrations with enterprise platforms such as ServiceNow, Cvent, Salesforce; experience with Crestron control system programming; Familiarity with Microsoft Teams and other M365 solutions; background with various forms of Workplace Technology and IoT solutions such as occupancy sensors, scheduling panels, digital signage and building control systems; experience working in an agile environment
• Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication, collaboration, analytical, and presentation skills to lead an environment driven by customer service and teamwork
• Possess a mindset focused on continuous improvement of processes and portfolio, enabling optimization and proactive troubleshooting, as well as remediation of any interruptions to employee experiences
• Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without the need for employment-based visa sponsorship now or in the future. KPMG LLP will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work visa status for this opportunity (no sponsorship is available for H-1B, L-1, TN, O-1, E-3, H-1B1, F-1, J-1, OPT, CPT or any other employment-based visa)

KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”.

Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA:

https://kpmg.com/us/en/how-we-work/pay-transparency.html/?id=6700_9_25

KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

KPMG does not currently require partners or employees to be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to KPMG offices, client sites or KPMG events, except when mandated by federal, state or local law. In some circumstances, clients also may require proof of vaccination or testing (e.g., to go to the client site).

KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them.

Los Angeles County applicants: Material job duties for this position are listed above. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness, and safeguard business operations and company reputation. Pursuant to the California Fair Chance Act, Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, and San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
